user.title: Connect to Elk-M1 Control
user.description: The address string must be in the form '<address>[:port]' for 'secure' and 'non-secure'.  Example: '192.168.1.1'. The port is optional and defaults to 2101 for 'non-secure' and 2601 for 'secure'. For the serial protocol, the address must be in the form '<tty>[:baud]'. Example: '/dev/ttyS1'. The baud is optional and defaults to 115200.

data.address: The IP address or domain or for serial the serial port that the Elk is connected to.
data.username: Username to login to Elk. Only required if using secure connection method.
data.password: Password to login to Elk. Only required if using secure connection method.
data.prefix: A unique prefix to identify this system. If you only have one Elk system, prefix may be omitted.
data.temperature_unit: The temperature unit that the Elk panel uses.

error.cannot_connect: Failed to connect, please try again

abort.already_configured: An ElkM1 with this prefix is already configured
